ygData.subject: The Otyebis' Worldwide Message
ygData.msgSnippet: President Kaiser: From atop the exact center of the mighty IGL craft, several antennaes extending, three orbs blasting off from what looked like three cannons
ygData.rawEmail:
Return-Path: <KSLawdogg@...>
X-Sender: KSLawdogg@...
X-Apparently-To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
Received: (EGP: mail-7_1_3); 22 Jun 2001 18:12:09 -0000
Received: (qmail 35516 invoked from network); 22 Jun 2001 18:12:07 -0000
Received: from unknown (10.1.10.142) by m8.onelist.org with QMQP; 22 Jun 2001 18:12:07 -0000
Received: from unknown (HELO imo-r03.mx.aol.com) (152.163.225.99) by mta3 with SMTP; 22 Jun 2001 18:12:07 -0000
Received: from KSLawdogg@... by imo-r03.mx.aol.com (mail_out_v30.22.) id r.f4.b9d647b (4381) for <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>; Fri, 22 Jun 2001 14:12:03 -0400 (EDT)
Message-ID: <f4.b9d647b.2864e473@...>
Date: Fri, 22 Jun 2001 14:12:03 EDT
Subject: The Otyebis' Worldwide Message
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Mailer: CompuServe 2000 32-bit sub 107
From: KSLawdogg@...

President Kaiser:




From atop the exact center of the mighty IGL craft, several antennaes 
extending, three orbs blasting off from what looked like three cannons on 
other sides, quickly ascending until they were in Earth's orbit, the orbs 
transforming into satellites.

With the powerful antennaes and positioning of the satellites the IGL would 
be able to communicate with all the major bases rather well and they would 
even be able to get their transmission through jamming systems.

Depending on the type of base and its equipment, either an audio or audio and 
picture message would appear.  Most likely the audio and view of the 
President speaking.  The message consisted of:

A slightly menacing robot who was thirteen feet tall, though it was hard to 
tell with him sitting in a large black luxurious chair.  His body was a 
comfortable mix of red and gold.  On primarily red colored chest there was a 
golden symbol of the IGL, a sword with a shield behind it.  His blue optic 
sensors brightened as he first spoke.

"Congratulations, Cybertronians and any other beings," Kaiser began, his 
voice very deep, "I am President Kaiser of the IGL, the Intergalactic 
Gladiatorial League.  Now I know you are all busy plotting and scheming 
futily to defeat your opponents but believe me, this is a very important 
message that could thrust the balance of power into your favor."

"The IGL holds matches year long, but only once every year do they hold the 
Intergalactic Gladiatorial League Combat Championships.  We were hoping that 
some if not almost all of you Cybertronians would participate in this.  There 
will be two divisions.  The Regular, and the Gestalt.  The regular will 
consist of normal combatants with numerous one on one battles until there is 
a final one on one battle to determine the IGL Champion of the Regular 
League.  The victor will receive five protoforms and equipment to make mold 
them into anything they desire, including a gestalt team."

"No doubt that would help any faction begin rising to power.  And for the 
Gestalt League, all gestalt teams may fight one one, as in one gestalt team 
against the other.  These 'one' on 'one' matches will continue until there 
are only two teams left and the victor of that final bout will be IGL 
Champions of the Gestalt League.  They will receive armor modifications, 200 
kilos of liquid energon, and if they fight well enough a protoform and 
equipment for them to do with as they wish."

"Normally the bouts are not fights to the deaths, but upon request and 
agreement from the combatants this kind of match can occur (if you have any 
spare chars. you need to kill off, hint, hint).  A faction may enter as many 
warriors into each league as wanted.  In example, one faction could enter 
twenty-five robots into a league.  Or if they had four gestalt teams, they 
could enter them into the league.  Although, they would have to fight each 
other as if they were enemies."

"Our craft, the Otyebis, is a mighty ship and assassination is not something 
to worry about.  If we wanted you dead, it would've been much easier to 
simply bombard you from orbit with our grealty superior weapons, or overrun 
you with our many garrisons of assorted beings.  But that's not we will do.  
There is a zero tolerance for fighting outside of the arenas.  We will not 
allow your petty differences to interfere with our show.  Anyone who attacks 
our craft will be obliterated.  If a target of an enemy faction is in a 
middle of a match and his enemies attempt to interfere, we will crush them."

A smile crept up on the lips of the non-Cybertronian robot.  "You can 
register into the IGL by simply sending transmissions to our ship, we have 
the resouces to deal with constant messages.  You have (two IRL weeks) to 
register.  Feel free to ask any questions (send 'em to KSLawDogg@...) when 
you send your transmissions.  This message will replay for 48 hours in case 
anyone misses this message."

The IGL President was replaced by the golden IGL symbol with a background of 
red.

(If you have any questions, e-mail me.  This isn't a trick to crush people, 
Yan won't allow it.  Just something I thought of to add a little spice to the 
attack, retreat, attack theme that seems to be going on in the RPG.  Since 
Yanshosh and I have characters in the IGL command, we are not allowed to win 
because it would seem unfair.  The way the winner will be decided is as if it 
were a real battle.  Whoever's character(s) give first lose.  There will be 
no complete retreats, though in some matches there will be different 
terrians, such as forest, etc, for people to run and try and hide in if 
things get dicy)
